title: Muslim center slams Jewish cemetery vandalism, vows to help after Philadelphia attack - Diaspora - Jerusalem Post
text:
Muslim center slams Jewish cemetery vandalism, vows to help after Philadelphia attack By JPOST.COM STAFF February 27, 2017 12:49 In the spirit of the 'City of Brotherly Love,' the Ahmadiyya Muslim Community USA expresses solidarity with "Jewish sisters and brothers." Gravestones damaged at Mt. Carmel Cemetery in Philadelphia , Pennsylvania , US. (photo credit:screenshot) 
The local branch of a Muslim community center in Philadelphia has condemned the vandalism of Jewish cemeteries in the US over the last week, including the desecration of a Pennsylvania cemetery where over 100 headstones were found destroyed on Sunday.The Mt. Carmel Cemetery in Philadelphia was the second Jewish funerary grounds targeted within a single week, after a cemetery near St. Louis suffered similar vandalism the previous weekend. In light of the latest in a recent series of antisemitic incidents in the US, the Ahmadiyya Muslim Community USA on Sunday vowed to deploy teams to help tend to the damage caused at the Jewish cemetery in Philadelphia. President of @PhillyMosque expressing solidarity w/our Jewish sisters & brothers at the vandalized Philadelphia Jewish cemetery. pic.twitter.com/AY1jXntF8S — Qasim Rashid, Esq. (@MuslimIQ) February 26, 2017 "We are deeply troubled by these rising and ongoing attacks on our Jewish sisters and brothers, and members from our Philadelphia chapter are in route to assist in clean up," said Dr. Nasim Rehmatullah, the national vice presidents for the Muslim community organization. "We call upon all Americans to stand united against this hatred and extremism," he added in a statement. The Muslim organization expressed solidarity with the American Jewish community and pledged its readiness to "serve and protect our Jewish sisters and brothers against these acts of intolerance and hatred, and pray for our nation's safety." President of @PhillyMosque Ahmadiyya Muslim Community at the vandalized Philadelphia Jewish cemetery to express solidarity & condolences. pic.twitter.com/zFtNKNorDN — Qasim Rashid, Esq. (@MuslimIQ) February 26, 2017 The Ahmadiyya Muslim Community is said to be among the oldest American-Muslim organizations in the US with its establishment in the country in 1920. US Vice President Mike Pence was among those to visit the desecrated Philadelphia cemetery over the weekend after the attack and vowed to fight the scourge of antisemitism with the weight of the White House. Last week, Muslim activists along with the Jewish governor of Missouri, Eric Greitens, were among those to volunteer to help repair the St. Louis-area Jewish cemetery where at least 170 gravestones were toppled.Activists Linda Sarsour and Tarek El-Messid launched a crowdfunding campaign to raise $20,000 for repairs for the cemetery with any remaining funds going toward fixed for other vandalized Jewish centers. At the time this article was written the campaign had raised over $133,000 US dollars. Michael Wilner JTA contributed to this report. Relevant to your professional network?
